meanings.definition: A person who assesses the value of crops or goods for taxation purposes.
meanings.sent1: The fiars carefully evaluated the worth of the harvested crops.
meanings.sent2: The fiars determined the value of the goods before tax assessment.
meanings.sent3: The fiars joked about being the 'value detectives' of the village.
meanings.sent4: In the market of opinions, the fiars were the judges of worth.
meanings.sent5: The fiars' job was to uncover the true value hidden in the produce.

meanings.definition: A person who holds a lease on church lands.
meanings.sent1: The fiars managed the church lands with care and responsibility.
meanings.sent2: The fiars were entrusted with the lease of the sacred church grounds.
meanings.sent3: The fiars playfully referred to themselves as the 'land guardians' of the church.
meanings.sent4: The church lands flourished under the watchful eye of the fiars.
meanings.sent5: The fiars' lease on the church lands was a position of great honor and duty.

meanings.definition: A person who is authorized to fix the price of grain.
meanings.sent1: The fiars set the fair price for grain in the market.
meanings.sent2: The fiars had the power to establish the cost of grain for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The fiars humorously called themselves the 'grain price rulers'.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of grain, the fiars were the ultimate decision-makers.
meanings.sent5: The fiars' role was to ensure a just and reasonable price for all grain buyers.
